chunks.en: Can I sue my parents to get back the bride price they pocketed?
Due to the severe patriarchal mindset, the 100,000 yuan bride price that was verbally promised to be returned is now not being given. Can the couple sue their parents to get it back?

I don't know if there is any voice evidence of the previous verbal promise, and the recent chat records show that he directly said that the debt will not be given. Can this be used as direct evidence to sue for it back?

Today's turtle (referring to someone groveling to foreigners) on 2EX, I'm shocked by the comments above.
Are we going to calculate the debt of raising him? Then why doesn't the woman give 100,000 yuan to the man's parents to thank them for raising him?
This post is good, I can update my Block list again.
100,000, is it worth suing your parents? What's wrong with this world?
@shuang You'd lie to your own daughter for 100,000?
@Shanky Is the parent-child relationship only worth 100,000? They raised you for so long. How did the relationship become like this?
Taking a step back, even if you feel it's wrong to pocket the bride price, you can choose to reduce contact or even stop seeing each other. It's not worth going to court.

I don't know how it's being twisted into selling a daughter. Some people's views are like this: Although you raised me for 20 years, since you cheated me this time, I can grab your handle. Next, I will not be polite, I will sue you in court. The parents are wrong, but you don't have to be aggressive and show off your edge, and sue for 100,000.

@Erroad #23 The people upstairs are unlikely to be turtles (groveling to foreigners). It is highly probable that they themselves are parents, also have daughters, and are patriarchal. Seeing so many people not supporting parents pocketing bride prices has triggered them.

You must sue them. Who told you to be patriarchal? Is the son human and the daughter not? When they are old, let the son take care of them. If they don't return the bride price, let them go to a nursing home. Hahaha, I can't help laughing.
@Erroad That's how national turtles (groveling to their own country) are. They deserve to be exploited to death by the bride price.
@shuang I have a feeling that you will also be parents who go back on their word and are patriarchal in the future.

My opinion: Maybe the parents did something wrong, promising to return the bride price before, but not returning it. Then I would choose to communicate with them in depth. Even if they don't return it, I will accept my discomfort and just assume that my parents never promised to return it. Parents also make mistakes. It is normal for parents and children to have quarrels and arguments. Unless absolutely necessary, it is best not to take the road of suing.
